Posts.Content: Jun 10, 2012 05:51AM GraciousGal wrote: If I understand correctly, you are wondering whether you should have a lumpectomy (LX) or a mastectomy (MX)? My BMX in January '12 took about 4 hours - 2 hours for each side. However, that was in conjunction with an immediate reconstruction. My lumpectomies in August '11 took about an hour - maybe two, with the SNBx (sentinel node biopsy). The recovery was vastly different. I didn't feel up to my normal energy level after the BMx until about 6 weeks out. The Lx recovery was almost immediately. We were moving to a new place and the moving truck arrived (with 10,000 pounds of "stuff") 10 days after my Lx. Although I was not allowed to lift any heavy things, I was able to keep up with everything (directing traffic for where to put furniture and boxes) all day long. Then I unpacked boxes for the next 3 days at a slower pace. It would have been crazy to do that after a BMx.  That all being said, I agree with Soyaandpepper - length of surgery is not a valid determining factor for which one you choose. I am so sorry for the challenges you are facing right now. One day at a time. . . Glad you have found this site.
